acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 72-hour EC50>120mg/L of algae (Green algae) (EU-RAR, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50 >5000mg/kg (DFGOTvol.18 (2002)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the descriptions that 6/6 survival with 16000ppm/4h, 6/6 death with 32000ppm (DFGOTvol.18 (2002)) and rat LC50 >16170ppm/4h (EU-RAR (2003)), it was classified as out of Category

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: > 5000 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: DFGOT vol.18 (2002)

SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 6482 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: EU-RAR (2003)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data and reports

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =2.43*105mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There was a statement that it gave negative result in the rat micronucleus test (erythrocyte) (EU-RAR (2003)), and we classified it as Out Of Category according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Since there is no data, it cannot be classified.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: According to statements that there was eye irritation by exposure to vapors to humans (EU-RAR (2003)),  severe irritation (a stimulus of a cornea and the iris, redness of a conjunctiva, dropsy, bleeding) was accepted by the test of the rabbit, and the recovery on less than the 7th was also observed (EU-RAR (2003)). And it was segmented into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the descriptions that it has no stimulation with application on humans (EU-RAR (2003),(DFGOTvol.18 (2002)) and that it has no stimulation on rabbits (EU-RAR (2003)), it was classified as out of Category.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: It was put outside of the Category because a statement says that sensitization was not identified in a maximization test conducted by volunteers(EU-RAR (DFGOTvol.18 (2002)) (2003)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since data is insufficient, it cannot be classified. (The adverse effects in the animal studies was seen by exposure concentration higher than a guidance value.)

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation) by the statement of the stimulativeness of a respiratory tract and the pharynx in humans (PATTY (5th, 2002), DFGOTvol.18 (2002), ACGIH (2001), EU-RAR(2003)). There are dizziness, vertigo, headache, an unstable walk, vision disappearance of both eyes, withering of an optic nerve, scotoma expansion of a left eye, the tunnel vision of a right eye, and the anesthesia action (EU-RAR (2003)) to occupational exposure in humans , it is classified into Category 1 (nervous systems).
